channel.title: Wireless LANs - Perfect Dark Mode
channel.description: multiple VLANs must be brought to it over a trunk link. The wireless side of an AP inherently trunks 802.11 frames by marking them with the BSSID of the WLAN where they belong. lightweight AP Wired VLANs that terminate at the WLC can be mapped to WLANs that emerge at the AP. The AP needs only an access link to connect to the network infrastructure and terminate its end of the tunnel
